item.title: SecNotes - Notes & bits
item.description: Vulnerability Assessment File Transfers

item.title: SecNotes - Vulnerability Assessment
item.description: Methodology 8 steps: Conduct Risk Identification And Analysis Develop Vulnerability Scanning Policies Identity The Type Of Scans Configure And Perform The Scan Evaluate And Consider Possible Risks Interpret The Scan Results Prioritize vulns with public exploit (CVEs and such) over vulns that needs more scripting and setup Create A Remediation & Mitigation Plan Inform and delegate Terms Vulnerability Weakness or bug in an organization’s env, including applications, networks, and infrastructure.

item.title: OSINT - PWNME 2023
item.description: OSINT Challenges PWNME 2023 edition This osint challenge consisted of a single scenario scattered in multiple (5) sections where we had to gather information about a person: John Droper

item.title: HTB - Netmon
item.description: Netmon is an easy windows box on HTB that allows anonymous FTP access to the C:\ drive and have an out of date, CVE vunlerable Paessler PRTG Network Monitor (Netmon) that runs as SYSTEM.

item.title: HTB - Sauna
item.description: Sauna is an easy HTB windows machine involving real world user guessing, improper Active Directory configuration such as no pre-authentication enabled, misconfigured service accounts and password reuse.

item.title: HTB - Active
item.description: Active is an easy HTB box that allows anonymous login on its SMB share. In one of the shares we can access the configuration file of a GPP (Group Policy Preference).

item.title: PWNME 2023
item.description: PWNME 2023 is the 2023 edition of a CTF made by the French cybersecurity school Ecole 2600. It was a good CTF with interesting challenges and a large cash prize even though there were some issues with the CTF web infrastructure.

item.title: SecNotes - HTB
item.description: Writeups on retired machines, sorted by difficulty Easy Medium Hard Insane Woa much empty
